item.title: Oil spillage from traffic accident, 19th July
item.description:
Report of oil spillage on the road due to a vehicle accident Fire services have attended and put sand over spillage however still obstructing traffic and preventing vehicle movement The junction between clarence road and page heath lane 5 Westwood Close Bromley BR1 2JJ Police Ref - CAD140519JULY2025

item.title: Steels Road and Haverstock Hill Junction, 19th July
item.description:
Concerns Regarding Recent Road Alterations at the Intersection of Haverstock Hill and Steeles Road 1. Positioning of Road Signs: The stop signage for vehicles exiting Steeles Road onto Haverstock Hill is positioned significantly back from the main road. This placement creates confusion for drivers and makes it difficult to safely and clearly assess oncoming traffic before proceeding. 2. Hazardous Bollard: There is a black-painted bollard in front of the post box at this junction. Due to its colour and positioning—combined with the way the road has been leveled off with the cycle lane—this bollard becomes virtually invisible at night. It poses a collision hazard, and we are concerned that without appropriate markings or lighting, accidents are likely. 3. Poor Road Surface Quality: The surface of the road at the Steeles Road junction is notably uneven and bumpy. It does not appear to have been fully or adequately resurfaced following the recent works. Given these issues, I kindly request that Camden Council urgently conducts an onsite visit of this section of road. I would urge the Council to conduct an onsite visit to assess the conditions themselves.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Steele's Road, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaking Food Waste (communal), 19th July
item.description:
The communal food waste bin for Denman House at the Edward Lane gate is leaking. There is black, thick liquid seeping onto the floor, a very strong and unpleasant smell, and it is attracting hundreds of flies. Please fix (or remove and replace) urgently.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Edwards Lane, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped Desk, 19th July
item.description:
This has been outside 34 Thompson Road for roughly 1 month. Tenants/owners in 34 keep moving the desk away from their house. Prevously there was lots of bulky waste sitting outside outside 34 and 32 for long periods of time so I am unsure which house is the perpetrator.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Thompson Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: LL62KKA and SF05XNX, 19th July
item.description:
Dear Rotherhithe Safer Neighbourhood Team, I wish to report two vehicles that park nightly on the pavement at 205 Rotherhithe Street, SE16 4XS, blocking a designated fire exit. This has occurred every night for 3 months, creating a serious safety hazard for all residents. I have previously contacted Southwark Council (parking@southwark.gov.uk) multiple times with no resolution. The drivers are also frequently noisy and dismissive when spoken to, ignoring lawful requests. Please can you urgently investigate this matter and take enforcement action under appropriate traffic and public safety regulations? I can provide photos and vehicle registration numbers upon request. East Globe Wharf, SE16 4XS

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rotherhithe Street, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet
